definition: to exchange thoughts and opinions in speech : talk
examples: spent a few minutes conversing about the weather
The leaders were bellowing so loudly that you had to shout to converse with your dinner partner.
… Mrs Walker, like many other mothers, was apt to be more free in converse with her daughter than she was with her son.
Graham Bretton had dined with us that day; he had shone both in converse and looks.

definition: something reversed in order, relation, or action: such as
a theorem formed by interchanging the hypothesis and conclusion of a given theorem
a proposition obtained by interchange of the subject and predicate of a given proposition
examples: "No P is S " is the converse of "no S is P. "

definition: reversed in order, relation, or action
examples: Socrates, while he said that the true tragic writer was also an artist in comedy, did not lay down the converse proposition that the true comic writer is also an artist in tragedy.

definition: being a logical or mathematical converse
